name: 1-(phenylsulfonyl)pyrrole
Reason: 1-(phenylsulfonyl)pyrrole has a phenyl group, a sulfonyl group, and a pyrrole ring. The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5°C. The phenyl group can increase the melting point due to π-π interactions and molecular rigidity, contributing around +30 to +50°C. The sulfonyl group can increase the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular weight, contributing around +20 to +40°C. The pyrrole ring can increase the melting point due to its aromaticity and ability to form weak hydrogen bonds, contributing around +10 to +20°C.
